trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Elf Weapon Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

trait.name: Fleet of Foot
trait.text: Your ground speed increases to 35 feet.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Elves love freedom, variety, and self-expression, so they lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They value and protect others' freedom as well as their own, and they are more often good than not.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.
